data.title: University Libraries
data.meta_description: Located in Washington, D.C., The Catholic University of America is the national university of the Catholic Church, founded by the U.S. bishops and the pope, faithful to the teachings of Jesus Christ as handed on by the Church.  Dedicated to advancing the dialogue between faith and reason, Catholic University seeks to discover and impart the truth through excellence in teaching and research. It offers academic degrees in Architecture, Arts and Sciences, Business and Economics, Canon Law, Engineering, Law, Library Science, Music, Nursing, Philosophy, Social Work, and Theology. The CUA Cardinals athletic teams compete in the NCAA Division III Landmark Conference and, in football, the Old Dominion Athletic Conference.

New Exhibit - Spotlight on Success: Luminary Alumni.

Mullen It Over - Summer 2024 Issue

The summer edition of Mullen It Over is here. Whether you are enjoying a break or hitting the books, Mullen Library is here for you! Take a look by clicking the link below!

Welcome to LinkedIn Learning @ Catholic University!

Welcome to LinkedIn Learning at Catholic University! The LinkedIn Learning video library is an excellent resource offering more than 7,500 self-paced training classes on a wide range of computer and project management skills for beginning, intermediate, and advanced users. It is free to the Catholic University community. Watch an introductory video or simply get started now by clicking here.
